      GetProfileAttr returns the value of an attribute in a user profile.

      The GetService method returns a specified business service.
      void InvokeMethod(java.lang.String methodName, java.lang.String methodArgs)
      InvokeMethod calls a specialized method or user-defined method specified by its argument.
      java.lang.String LoginId()
      The LoginId method returns the login ID of the user who started the Siebel application.
      java.lang.String LoginName()
      The LoginName method returns the login name of the user who started the Siebel application (the name typed in the login dialog box).
      SiebelPropertySet NewPropertySet()
      The NewPropertySet method constructs a new property set object.
      java.lang.String PositionId()
      The PositionId property returns the position ID (ROW_ID from S_POSTN) of the user’s current position.
      java.lang.String PositionName()
      The PositionName property returns the position name of the user’s current position.

      The RaiseErrorText method raises a scripting error message to the browser.
      void SetProfileAttr(java.lang.String paramName, java.lang.String paramValue)
      SetProfileAttr is used in personalization to assign values to attributes in a user profile.

      The Trace method appends a message to the trace file.
      void TraceOff()
      TraceOff turns off the tracing started by the TraceOn method.
      void TraceOn(java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.String type, java.lang.String selection)
      TraceOn turns on the tracking of allocations and deallocations of Siebel objects and SQL statements generated by the Siebel application.

    • Method Detail

      • GetBusObject

        public SiebelBusObject GetBusObject(java.lang.String objName)
        The GetBusObject method instantiates and returns a new instance of the business object specified in its argument.
        Parameters:
        objName - String variable or literal containing the name of the business object to instantiate.
        Returns:
        The business object instance specified in the argument

      • GetProfileAttr

        public java.lang.String GetProfileAttr(java.lang.String paramName)
        GetProfileAttr returns the value of an attribute in a user profile.
        Parameters:
        paramName - A string indicating the name of the attribute
        Returns:
        The value of the attribute name

      • SetProfileAttr

        public void SetProfileAttr(java.lang.String paramName,
                  java.lang.String paramValue)
        SetProfileAttr is used in personalization to assign values to attributes in a user profile.
        Parameters:
        paramName - A string indicating the name of the attribute
        paramValue - The value of name

      • Trace

        public void Trace(java.lang.String str)
        The Trace method appends a message to the trace file. Trace is useful for debugging SQL query execution and the allocation of the objects. This tracing is not the same as the tracing that can be activated in the application’s CFG file.
        Parameters:
        str - message to trace

      • TraceOff

        public void TraceOff()
        TraceOff turns off the tracing started by the TraceOn method.

      • TraceOn

        public void TraceOn(java.lang.String fileName,
           java.lang.String type,
           java.lang.String selection)
        TraceOn turns on the tracking of allocations and deallocations of Siebel objects and SQL statements generated by the Siebel application.

      • PositionId

        public java.lang.String PositionId()
        The PositionId property returns the position ID (ROW_ID from S_POSTN) of the user’s current position. This is set by default when the Siebel application is started and may be changed (through Edit > Change Position) if the user belongs to more than one position.
        Returns:
        A string row ID

      • PositionName

        public java.lang.String PositionName()
        The PositionName property returns the position name of the user’s current position. This is set by default when the Siebel application is started.
        Returns:
        A string containing the user’s position

      • LoginId

        public java.lang.String LoginId()
        The LoginId method returns the login ID of the user who started the Siebel application.
        Returns:
        A string containing the login ID

      • LoginName

        public java.lang.String LoginName()
        The LoginName method returns the login name of the user who started the Siebel application (the name typed in the login dialog box).
        Returns:
        A string containing the user’s login name

      • InvokeMethod

        public void InvokeMethod(java.lang.String methodName,
                java.lang.String methodArgs)
        InvokeMethod calls a specialized method or user-defined method specified by its argument.
        Parameters:
        methodName - The name of the method.
        methodArgs - One or more strings containing arguments to methodName.

      • GetService

        public SiebelService GetService(java.lang.String serviceName)
        The GetService method returns a specified business service. If the business service is not already running, it is constructed.
        Parameters:
        serviceName - The name of the service to start
        Returns:
        A reference to the requested business service

      • NewPropertySet

        public SiebelPropertySet NewPropertySet()
        The NewPropertySet method constructs a new property set object.
        Returns:
        A property set

      • RaiseErrorText

        public void RaiseErrorText(java.lang.String errMsg)
        The RaiseErrorText method raises a scripting error message to the browser. The error text is the specified literal string. The optional arguments are used to format the string if it contains any substitution arguments (%1, %2).
        Parameters:
        errMsg - error message show in dialog
